paragraphs.text: Beyond New Year's Resolutions: Fifteen ways to improve your life in 2015.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: New Year's resolutions often lose their power so quickly and completely that they have become cliche
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: But there are real, easily achieved ways to positively impact your life beginning January 1
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I've assembled a cheat sheet of 15
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They aren't in any particular order
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you can pick any one to start with
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you complete just five
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you'll notice a demonstrable improvement in your existence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you get through all 15
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you could remake your life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Try to recall one dream you had as a kid-- whether it was being a poet or a rock drummer or a multimillionaire stock trader-- and take just a single step in that direction
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So often
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the ideas we had as children were good ones
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we abandoned them out of fear
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The step in the direction of your childhood dream can be very modest
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: signing up for a symposium on poetry, scheduling a single drum lesson, buying a DVD on stock trading
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Frozen dreams have a way of thawing out rapidly when you warm them just a tiny bit
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Think of your life story, going all the way back to infancy, as an autobiographical book that you can hold in your hands
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Now
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: imagine which page or paragraph you are tempted to tear out and remove from the story
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That page or paragraph might be the one that makes you feel profoundly sad or powerless or guilty or ashamed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Next
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: share it with someone who knows you well but has never heard about that event or phase in your life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Being willing to disclose the events in life we want to turn a blind eye to takes away the power those events have over us
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Give a meaningful gift to a friend of yours on a random day -- not his birthday or her anniversary or Christmas
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Giving gifts on those days is fine
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that isn't the same as an unexpected, unscheduled gift
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Those are the ones that feel riskier to give and have more power to bond you to others who receive them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And that's because they're real and independent expressions of friendship, affection, admiration or love
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Send handwritten notes to three people you admire most in the world, no matter how powerful or famous
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: tell them sincerely exactly why you admire them
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: and ask to meet for 10 minutes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There' s a real chance one of them will take you up on the offer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that one meeting could change you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because great energy is contagious
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: being in the company of it can stay with you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Give some amount (no matter how small) to the charity you care most about
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Giving is a miracle
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because it helps others while also telling your unconscious mind that yours is a life of abundance, not scarcity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And that invites more treasures into your existence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Stop telling yourself you love people just because you grew up with them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is a big one, but a really important one
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Did your parents and siblings earn your love by unconditionally loving you as a child?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: If so, great
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you've been wishing that had been the case and have felt unwilling to let the dream of having had unconditionally loving parents or siblings slip away
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: loosen your grip
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the people you grew up with weren't focused on helping
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you stay true to yourself
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: then admit it to yourself
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You might stop unconsciously recruiting people just like them into your life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Schedule an initial psychotherapy session
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Psychotherapy is the gold standard way to begin to get to know yourself more deeply
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In a world of distractions and depersonalization, it remains the technique most reliably focused on restoring your connection to your true self
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Hopefully
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that first session will convince you of the power of psychotherapy to change your life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you'll schedule more
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No one with the financial ability to be in psychotherapy should deny himself or herself that transformational opportunity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Get angry about something unfair, say so out loud and don't stand for it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Anger gets a really bad rap in our culture
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it's accused of everything from destroying people spiritually to causing heart attacks
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But suppressed anger can be more toxic. When you're offended by something you hear about in the news or you see unfolding in your personal life, try saying so, in no uncertain terms, when you're asked about it -- or maybe even if you aren't
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For those of you who have been living lives of quiet frustration, letting yourselves be very direct and very mad about something that sincerely outrages you can start to crack the shell that has your most powerful self inside it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Take two minutes to think about life as a labyrinth
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mazes are built to frustrate people and get them lost
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: They're full of dead ends designed to make people give up and call for helicopters to pluck them out
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Not so with labyrinths
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Labyrinths may wind this way and that way
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: They may take you far from where you thought you were heading
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But they always, always lead to the center
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: And that's what life is like
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Keep walking, keep your faith and life will take you where you are supposed to go
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The turn toward the center could be just a few steps away
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , when you least expect it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Try praying, at least once
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you haven't prayed ever or haven't prayed lately
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you'll discover that the act of praying for what you care deeply about has the effect of reminding you what that thing or those things really are
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It also has the effect of reminding you that there is a great power in the universe that you are a part of
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There' s something interesting about praying
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: even people who say they don't believe in God are loathe to pray for the opposite of what they really want
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How come?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Is it because that, underneath all that cynicism, they actually do believe?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Read "Franny and Zooey" by J.D  Salinger, "The War of Art" by Steven Pressfield or "Blue Dog" by George Rodrigue (or, even better, all three)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These slim volumes have the power to transform people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I keep handing them out to patients and friends
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: (along with
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: please forgive the narcissism -- my book
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: "Living the Truth")
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Buy one piece of art. It doesn't need to be expensive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It just needs to appeal to you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Why?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Because art is the antidote to our sometimes sterile, technologically driven culture
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It makes humanity go viral in a way that YouTube can't
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It also confirms your connection to things that can't be measured -- like your personal vision of beauty
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Watch the movie "Miracle," with Kurt Russell
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This film about the 1980 U.S  Olympic men's hockey team defeating Russia's team is so good
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it can convince you to take on the next great challenge in your life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I don't know anyone who has watched it and been unaffected by it
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Tell your romantic partner one thing you would find exciting that you have not yet told that person
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In my experience as a therapist, I've found that people can remain strangers to one another, in terms of passion, even after 10 or 20 years of marriage
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: We keep sexual secrets
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Let one out
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: See what happens
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Take the risk
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Stand up for someone else
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You'll have the opportunity in 2015
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I promise
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Maybe in your home. Maybe in your neighborhood. Maybe at work. Defending someone will reassure that person and empower you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So, there are your 15 keys to making 2015 a transformational year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Don't delay
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Start on the list January 1
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: by this time next year, God willing, you'll be ready for the 16 steps for 2016
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Like is life that: a never-ending process of self-improvement
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Dr  Keith Ablow is a psychiatrist and member of the Fox News Medical A-Team
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Dr  Ablow can be reached at info@keithablow.com
paragraphs.label: other
